text: Espinosa in action Andrés Espinosa Pérez (born 4 February 1963 in Matehuala, San Luis Potosi) is a retired Mexican long-distance runner who specialized in marathon races. Espinosa finished ninth at the 1995 World Championships in 2:16:44 hours. He won the 1993 New York Marathon and achieved his personal best time of 2:07:19 hours at the 1994 Boston Marathon. He set the world masters (+40) record for the marathon in Berlin Marathon 2003 (2:08:46), which lasted nearly a dozen years until it was broken by 2 seconds in 2015 by Evergreen Kenneth Mungara.
